title: epi2me-labs/wf-human-variation
description: Basecalling, SNV calling, SV calling, modified base calling of human samples.

workflow.title: Workflow Options
workflow.description: Select which sub-workflows of wf-human-variation you wish to run. Parameters for each sub-workflow can be changed using the sections below. Basecalling is run if you provide a FAST5 directory instead of a BAM in the Input Options.

sv.title: SV: Structural variants
sv.help_text: If this option is selected, structural variant calling will be carried out using Sniffles2.

snp.title: SNP: Small variants
snp.help_text: If this option is selected, small variant calling will be carried out using Clair3.

cnv.title: CNV: Copy number variants
cnv.help_text: If this option is selected, copy number variant calling will be carried out using QDNAseq.

str.title: STR: Short tandem repeat expansions
str.description: Enable Straglr to genotype STR expansions.
str.help_text: If this option is selected, genotyping of STR expansions will be carried out using Straglr. This sub-workflow is only compatible with genome build 38.

mod.title: MOD: Modified bases aggregation
mod.description: Enable output of modified calls to a bedMethyl file [requires input BAM with Ml and Mm tags]
mod.help_text: This option is automatically selected and aggregation of modified calls with be carried out using modkit if Ml and Mm tags are found. Disable this option to prevent output of a bedMethyl file.

mapula.description: Enable mapula to generate basic alignment QC statistics (can be slow on very large data sets)
mapula.help_text: Mapula is a tool that is able to parse alignments and produce a range of useful stats. In most cases the other outputs are sufficient and this does not need to be enabled.

docs.intro:
## Introduction

This workflow uses [Clair3](https://www.github.com/HKU-BAL/Clair3) for calling small
variants from long reads. Clair3 makes the best of two methods: pileup (for fast
calling of variant candidates in high confidence regions), and full-alignment
(to improve precision of calls of more complex candidates).

This workflow uses [sniffles2](https://github.com/fritzsedlazeck/Sniffles) for
calling structural variants.

This workflow uses [modkit](https://github.com/nanoporetech/modkit) to
aggregate modified base calls into a [bedMethyl](https://www.encodeproject.org/data-standards/wgbs/) file.

This workflow uses [Dorado](https://github.com/nanoporetech/dorado/tree/master/dorado)
for basecalling `pod5` or `fast5` signal data.

This workflow uses [QDNAseq](https://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/QDNAseq.html) for calling copy number variants.

This workflow uses a fork of [Straglr](https://github.com/philres/straglr) for genotyping short tandem repeat expansions.
